div.l: All gate they wold her wyfes went so
And eke for she was somdele smoterlych
She was as deignous as water in a dych
So full of hoker and of bysmare
Hir thought that a lady shold hir spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortelry
That she hade lerned in the nonnery
A doughter they haden̄ bitwene hem two
Of xxᵗʸ yere wᵗithout ony mo
Save a child that was of half a yere age
In Cradle it lay and was a ꝓpropre page
This wench thyk and well begrowen̄ was
Wᵗith camuse nose / and eyen̄ gray as glas
Wᵗith buttokkes brode / and brestes round and hye
But right faire was hir here I woll nat lye
The ꝑperson̄ of the towne for she was faire
In purpose was to make hir his heire
Both of his catell / and his mesuage
And straunge he made it of hir mariage
His purpose was to bestowe hir hye
In to som̄ worthy blode of Auncetrye
For holy chirche gode mot be dispended
On holy chirche blode þᵗat is discended
Therfore he wold his holy blode honoᵘur
Though that he holy chirche shold deuoᵘur
Grete soken̄ hade þe myller out of dout
Wᵗith whete and malt / of all þe lond about
And namely there was a grete Collegge
Men clepen̄ it þe Soler hall of Cambregge
There was hir whete / and eke hir malt yground
And on̄ a day it happed in a stound
Seke lay the Maunciple on̄ a maladye
Men wenden̄ wisely that he shold dye
For which this myller͗e / stale both mele and corn̄
An ·C· tyme more / than he dyd byforn̄
For there byfore he stale but curteisly
But now he was a theef outrageously
For which the wardein chidde and made fare
But therof set the Miller nat a tare
He crakkes bost / and swore it was nat so
Than were there / yong poure scolers two
